description.raw:
Fix topic echo test and make msgs visible.

Note that the widget still crashes on destruction if messages have been received. 

I'm not sure why removing the buffer property solved the test failure, but it may be related to why destruction is still failing when there have been messages.

More info:

* Crash happens on `QQmlPropertyCache` destructor:

~~~
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(0x7fbcacc3acd7) [0x7fbcacc3acd7]                                                                                        
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD1Ev+0x6e) [0x7fbcace30fce]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace31419]                                                                                       
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN12QQmlMetaType24freeUnusedTypesAndCachesEv+0x345) [0x7fbcace01745]                                                                  
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlEnginePrivateD1Ev+0xb2) [0x7fbcacdd6272]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN28QQmlApplicationEnginePrivateD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace68649]                                                            
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN7QObjectD1Ev+0x643) [0x7fbcabc1da13]                                                                               
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN10QQmlEngineD1Ev+0x110) [0x7fbcacdda980]
~~~

* I tried using the pointer version of [QQmlContext::setContextProperty](https://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qqmlcontext.html#setContextProperty) as opposed to the reference version, because it says that it won't take ownership, but the crash still happens. Since it looks like the issue is related to a cache, maybe Qt is doing something else with the property, and I'm not sure how to prevent.

* I tried changing the remaining properties (`topic`, `paused`) like I did for `buffer` to fix the test, but the runtime crash still happens.

* There's no crash if the plugins are loaded in separate windows.
description.html:
Fix topic echo test and make msgs visible.

Note that the widget still crashes on destruction if messages have been received.

I'm not sure why removing the buffer property solved the test failure, but it may be related to why destruction is still failing when there have been messages.

More info:

  • Crash happens on QQmlPropertyCache destructor:
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(0x7fbcacc3acd7) [0x7fbcacc3acd7]                                                                                        
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD1Ev+0x6e) [0x7fbcace30fce]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlPropertyCacheD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace31419]                                                                                       
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN12QQmlMetaType24freeUnusedTypesAndCachesEv+0x345) [0x7fbcace01745]                                                                  
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN17QQmlEnginePrivateD1Ev+0xb2) [0x7fbcacdd6272]                                                                                      
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN28QQmlApplicationEnginePrivateD0Ev+0x9) [0x7fbcace68649]                                                            
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Core.so.5(_ZN7QObjectD1Ev+0x643) [0x7fbcabc1da13]                                                                               
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libQt5Qml.so.5(_ZN10QQmlEngineD1Ev+0x110) [0x7fbcacdda980]

  • I tried using the pointer version of QQmlContext::setContextProperty as opposed to the reference version, because it says that it won't take ownership, but the crash still happens. Since it looks like the issue is related to a cache, maybe Qt is doing something else with the property, and I'm not sure how to prevent.

  • I tried changing the remaining properties (topic, paused) like I did for buffer to fix the test, but the runtime crash still happens.

  • There's no crash if the plugins are loaded in separate windows.

title: Topic echo fix
